results.title: The Control of worms in sheep
results.creator_credit: Ritter-Jepperson Studios and Australian Wool Corporation
results.brief_description: Two neighbours, who own adjoining properties, both attempt to combat this disease in their sheep. The sheep in the first property are suffering from the combined effects of overstocking and worm parasites. On the second property, after a period of trial and error, what is termed correct stocking is achieved, and as a result, the worm problem solves itself. The film emphasises that sheep must be drenched at the right time and properly fed all the time.

results.title: The Control of foot rot
results.brief_description: Detailed explanation of causes, symptoms and effective treatment of foot rot in sheep. Isolated cases must be penned separately and the flock checked to ensure that the disease has not spread. In flocks where foot rot is widespread, the only solution is the thorough inspection of all sheep, paring and cutting away all unhealthy tissue and painting with an antibiotic solution, or administering a formalin foot bath.

results.title: The Continuous woman
results.brief_description: Entirely the product of collective effort, this film attempts the portrayal of real images of women by looking at five individuals who recognize their strengths and the possibility of alternative roles to those of tradition. Each woman speaks about herself and the portraits merge with one another in a continuous stream of music and photography toward a totality of impression.

results.title: The Consumer game
results.creator_credit: Pyramid Films, Directions Unlimited and Noel Nosseck
results.brief_description: Reviews psychological and motivational techniques used to sell a product. Explains the concepts of comparison shopping, unit pricing, convenient packaging, financing, guarantees and labels. Hosted by Artie Johnston.

results.title: The Consultation
results.creator_credit: Frances McGivern, AFTRS and Liz Crosby
results.brief_description: Betty (Leverne McDonnell) sees Larry (Matthew Crosby) across a bar. There is mutual interest, engagement, excitement, and of course, attraction. A stylish, erotic drama with a twist in the tale; a romance for the times we live in.

results.title: The Conscience of a child (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Harold Mayer, Edmond Levy, American Psychological Society and Mayar-Sklar Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Focus on behaviour: the science of psychology”.
The ways in which psychologists are studying, in the laboratory of Dr. Robert Sears at Stanford University, the growth and development of personality and emotional behaviour in children. The roles portrayed by Eddie, his mother and father are re-enactments based on actual research and findings in Dr Sears’ experiment.

results.title: The Conquered desert: Libya
results.brief_description: The Libyan Arab Republic since the revolution of September 1969 has progressed in many ways. There has been a development of an infrastructure of industry and agriculture. There is education for all, cultural centres, housing and health services. In fact, total self-sufficiency has been achieved since the revolution.

results.title: The Conciliation by Benjamin Duterrau, 1840
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Otton, David Muir, Tasmanian Film Corporation and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Australian eye II”.
This film looks at the works of Benjamin Duterrau, and in particular his painting “The Conciliation”. This was of importance as, based on the meeting of George Augustus Robinson in 1830 with a group of Tasmanian aborigines, it was the first painting of a historical scene created in Australia.
